title: Connecting the Dots | Europe plots constellation manufacturing powerhouse
summary: Thales Alenia Space is laying groundwork for a small satellite factory in Italy that it hopes will be at the forefront of constellation manufacturing in Europe, bringing the continent closer to mass production capabilities across the Atlantic.

title: Virgin Galactic expects no delay to next suborbital flight
summary: Virgin Galactic says it does not expect an investigation into an issue on its most recent suborbital launch to delay its next one as it turns its focus to a new generation of vehicles.

title: Rocket Lab pushing for first Neutron launch in 2024
summary: Rocket Lab says it could launch its first Neutron rocket before the end of the year as it outlines a long-term vision for the company that involves its own satellite constellation.

title: Astra founders reduce offer to take company private
summary: The founders of satellite propulsion and launch vehicle company Astra have sharply cut their offer to take the company private, warning of “imminent bankruptcy” if the company doesn’t accept their new proposal.

title: Rocket Lab says contract backlog tops $1 billion, outlines Neutron progress toward first launch
summary: Rocket Lab is making steady progress on the development of its Neutron vehicle, as the company reported fourth-quarter results that saw its contract backlog soar above $1 billion.

title: India Introduces First Astronaut Group
summary: India introduced its first group of astronauts today. They will not be the first Indians to fly into space — that distinction belongs to Rakesh Sharma — but are the […]

title: It turns out that Odysseus landed on the Moon without any altimetry data
summary: "Hours after we got off the launch pad, we almost lost the spacecraft."

title: Space Force to lean on private sector for space tracking data
summary: Lt. Gen. Miller, head Space Operations Command: ‘We want to leverage capability for analytics, for data interpretation’

title: SpaceX nears third Starship launch clearance following FAA investigation closure
summary: SpaceX is nearing its clearance for the third Starship launch following the closure of a Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) investigation that was...

title: Astranis relocating hobbled debut satellite from Alaska to Asia
summary: Astranis is moving its debut satellite to a geostationary position over Asia after a malfunction last year derailed plans to beam broadband to Alaska, the Californian manufacturer said Feb. 27.
